DataElement.preferredName: Hematology Hemoglobin Assessment Yes No Exception Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/exception indicator whether there was a hematology assessment for hemoglobin, the red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to hematology assessment for hemoglobin, the red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredDefinition: The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: An instance that does not conform to a rule or generalization.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
An instance that does not conform to a rule or generalization.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs. bsm

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study hemoglobin great
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: 19.	Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 10 g/dL with no packed red blood cell transfusion in the past 28 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 10 g/dL with no packed red blood cell transfusion in the past 28 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than 9 g/dL or if KS patient, is pre study hemoglobin greater than 10 g/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than 8 g/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dL with no packed red blood cell transfusion in the past 28 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dl or greater than or equal to 4.9 mmol/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 10 g/dL with no packed red blood cell transfusion in the 14 days prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than 10 g/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9.5 g/dL, transfusion support acceptable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dL, within 14 days prior to treatment?

DataElement.changeDescription: 4/16/19 tmt changed Registration Status from Qualified to Application.  Curated for CITN-12. bsm
